review_blob: Really pale straw color out of the tap with a thin white head. Light toasted white bread nose with hints of lemon. Thin grainy taste with some bitter lemon citrus. Really not much here.

Clear golden color out or the bottle with a frothy cream colored head. Bright tropical fruit and sweet citrus hop nose. This is a very juicy hop forward beer. The body does suggest the session status. Tons of tropical fruit, candied orange rind, stone fruit and a bit of resin bitterness in the finish give this lots of flavor. This is a good addition to the session IPA ranks.

Deep mahogany color when held against the light. Thick, foamy beige head. Nice roasted grain nose with some dark chocolate and puffed wheat notes. Flavors of dark chocolate, roasted grains, chalk, a bit of ash, and some coffee bitterness in the finish. I quite enjoyed this porter.

Deep golden color beer out of the howler with a lasting white head. Orange, tangerine and red grapefruit citrus nose. Caramel sweetness with some bitter orange, grapefruit rind, peach, apricot and a bit of tropical fruit hop flavors that end in a solid, bitter pine and resin note. It is dry, and it is a nice IPA.

Copper color out of the bottle with a sticky off white head. Big citrus hop nose. Big malty backbone with huge orange and candied grapefruit rind citrus notes. The alcohol really comes out as it warms. Big malty beer with lots of hops.
beer_name: Heavy Seas / Maine Beer Partner Ships Red IPA

review_blob: Amber color with a frothy off white head. Big citrus hop nose. Big sweet malty flavors with candied citrus rind, marmalade and an earthy sheen. Sweet tropical fruit finish with some pine notes. Interesting IPA.

This is the thunder kissed version. Dark beer with a creamy beige head. Sweet lactic acid and coffee nose. This has all the roasted grain flavor and lactose sweetness of the regular with a strong coffee taste. Not bitter at all. Very nice addition.

Acme color with a lasting off white head. Big fresh hop resin nose. This is a juicy hop beer with lots of tropical fruit, candied citrus and resin. Firm malty back bone. Really drinks like an ipa. Fat Heads knows how to do hops.
beer_name: Fat Heads Whole Lotta Love Pale Ale

review_blob: Dark mahogany beer with a short lived tan head. Sweet malt nose with a bit of dark roasted grains in the nose. Thick, rich mouth feel. Molasses and burnt caramel sweetness with some ash, burnt toast, overripe fruit, and a noticeable alcohol burn as it warms. Nice, rich porter.
beer_name: ABC Beers Haagse Harry Pogtah Bieah (Baltic Porter)

review_blob: Orange color out of the bottle with a slight haze. Fluffy off white head that left plenty of lacing on the glass. Fresh tropical fruit hop nose. Sweet caramel and tropical fruit flavors with some candied orange rind and a pinching hop bitterness in the finish. Tasty, but not as fruity as some of the tropical themed IPAs.
beer_name: Sierra Nevada Beer Camp Tropical IPA

review_blob: Pale yellow color with a quickly dissipating white head that disappeared to a lively bubbling liquid. Sweet blossom honey nose. Delightful honey sweet flavor with hints of orange, green apple and vanilla. Very nice, straight up honey mead.

Deep orange color out of the can with a sticky eggshell head. Floral, spice and lime in the nose. Caramel sweetness with some lightly toasted grains, with lime and a sweet/tart fruitiness to it. Some grassy bitterness in the finish that I didnt mind. Not my usual thing but I quite liked this.
beer_name: Platform Cherimoya Project - Dry Hopped Kaffir Pale

review_blob: Golden color out of the bottle with a small off white head. Orange citrus nose. Caramel sweetness and some light toasted white bread with tropical fruit and a bit of orange juice. Some grassy bitterness in the finish. This is a little thin, which I attribute to the process to "remove" whatever they did here. Okay pale ale.

Pale yellow color with a fizzy white head. Light tangy nose with some citrus notes. Some tangy grapefruit juice, thin sweetness and and odd sweet/tart flavor that Ill credit to the cactus. It has that slimy salty taste I expect from a gose style. Not really my thing.

I drank this at room temperature as per the bottles suggestion. The plastic cork did shoot itself off the bottle when I undid the seal. Otherwise, only a few bubbles in the glass would suggest any carbonation. Deep yellow color. Nose of sweet honey and a hint of spice. I dont know if the heat has grown while this sat on my counter, but the pepper is VERY prevalent in here. Pepper heat is in the first sip and the pepper burn hits your throat when you swallow. There is lots of sweetness to it as well, but if you dont like heat, stay away. I do like heat, but this is right at the edge of too much for me.
beer_name: Melovino Melo Evil Ghost Pepper Mead

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: Copper color with a lasting off white head. Tropical fruit and candied citrus hop nose. Candied orange peel, mango, and earthy hops balance with a bit a caramel sweetness. I do get a bit a alcohol intrusion into what I feel should be a lighter style. Decent beer.
Golden color beer with a fizzy white head. Sweet grainy nose. This is a thin, grainy adjunct lager, with some orange and honey sweetness. There is really not much here.

Attractive light golden color with a foamy white head. Not much in the nose but a hint of hops. Some earthy and spicy hop notes with a thin graininess and a bit of lemon citrus in the finish. Okay pilsner.

Pale gold color out of the bottle with a fluffy white head. Light nose of grains and citrus hops. Biscuit and light toast with a fairly strong grassy and lemon hop notes. Nice, refreshing take on a pils.

Golden beer with a fluffy off white head. Dank hop cone nose with lots of candied citrus and tropical fruit notes. The pineapple is most obvious in the finish, but the hops dominate the rest of this beer. Candied citrus rind, tropical fruit, apricot, and resin all over a just strong enough malt backbone. Not as good as the grapefruit variant, but still a strong IPA novelty.

Dark beer out of the bottle with a brown slick for a head. Sweet nose of brown sugar, bourbon and vanilla. This is a sweet beer with noticeable lactose, brown sugar, burnt caramel, over the bourbon booze, vanilla, oak and dark fruits. Very smooth mouth feel. The claimed espresso addition is pretty subtle in the finish. Really sweet to me.
beer_name: Maumee Bay Bourbon Barrel Aged Total Eclipse Breakfast Stout

review_blob: Light amber color out of the can with an initial frothy off white head that shrank to very little quickly. Nose of berry and orange. The flavors included an intense berry fruitiness, sharp hops and a sweet malt profile. Some dusty hops in the finish. Interesting.

Pale copper color out of the howler with a foamy egg shell head. I didnt get a ton of hops in the nose. Mostly caramel malts. This is a malty pale ale, with sweet caramel, a hint of butterscotch, and some orange peel in the finish. Nothing wrong with it, but I had hoped for stronger hop presence given the deScription.
Amber color out of the bottle with a short egg shell head. Nose of tropical fruit and apricots. Flavors of candied apricot, tropical fruit and a hint of ginger heat in the finish. Interesting IPA.

Very dark beer out of the can(!) with an initial foamy beige head that shrank to a lasting ring. Big molasses and bourbon nose. Smooth mouth feel. This is a boozy BA stout, especially as it warms, but not in a bad way. Tons of bourbon, wet wood, vanilla, chocolate, brown sugar, and a bit of green bitterness. It may be that it is the end of the night, but this is a very nice nightcap. Rich chocolate and huge booze.

Dark beer out of the bottle with a lasting slick of brown foam for a head. Nose of booze roasted grains. This is a sweet beer that makes your lips sticky as you drink it. Brown sugar, molasses, burnt caramel, bourbon, wet wood, vanilla, and over ripe fruit flavors. Pretty boozy in the finish. Really sweet BA beer.
beer_name: Hinterland Out of the Woods Series - 20th Anniversary Bourbon Barrel Stout

review_blob: Golden color out of the keg with a short sticky white head. Big sweet citrus and tropical fruit hop nose. There is a lot of alcohol in this. Lots of candied grapefruit, mango, resin, and melted caramel. This is a big, sticky iipa.

Light amber color with a fluffy off white head. Bright citrus and tropical fruit hop nose. Caramel sweetness in the flavor with lots of tropical fruit, stone fruit and candied grapefruit peel. There is a bit of a grassy harshness in the finish. Solid pale ale.

Pale gold color out of the howler with a lasting, sticky white head. Fresh tropical and stone fruit hop nose. This is another very hoppy beer from Coronado, with lots of juicy peach, red grapefruit, tropical fruit and resin hop flavors. Thick caramel sweetness for a backbone. Very well balanced ABV. If you like the sweeter IIPAs, this is a good one.

Orange beer with a little haze. Fizzy white head. Light citrus and Brett nose. Im learning to like Brett more, but it is still not my favorite flavor. It adds a nice complement to the tropical fruit and sweet citrus rind hops and the malt profile. Interesting flavor, but not my favorite.

Dark beer out of the can with a short lived brown head that shrank to a lasting ring. Coffee and chocolate nose. This is definitely a coffee stout. Lots of coffee bean, bitter chocolate and vanilla flavors. Warming alcohol. Lightly roasted coffee bean bitterness in the finish. Solid coffee beer.

Dark beer out of the bottle. There is very little carbonation in this bottle. I got some brown bubbles when I poured but no head and not much action on the tongue. Molasses, burnt grain and buttered toast in the nose. Lots of lactic sweetness with burnt chocolate, toast, sweetened coffee and some grassy hops in the finish. Okay novelty stout.

Amber color beer with a huge, foamy khaki colored head. Bright pine and grapefruit rind hop nose. Flavors of pine, grapefruit rind, resin, stone fruits, coarse bread and marmalade. A bit of and alcohol burn as it warms. Nice enough IPA.

Golden beer out of the bottle with a sticky white head. Earthy hop nose with some cardboard and wet grain notes. Flavor of wet grain, muddled citrus and stone fruit hops, and an odd bitter grassy finish. Maybe a bit oxidized.

Pale gold color out of the bottle with a lasting, fluffy white head. Spicy nose with clove, yeast and fresh citrus hops. This is really tasty. Light malty backbone with strong bitter orange and red grapefruit flavors, some lemon peel, a hint of banana and yeasty bread dough. This is a style bending beer for sure that I quite enjoyed.
Light amber color with a foamy ivory head. Big fresh tropical fruit nose. Sweet beer with lots of stone fruit, tropical fruit, candied orange peel and pineapple. Really juicy IPA.

Burnished golden color out of the bottle with a fluffy white head. Fresh bright hop floral and citrus hop nose. Well balanced malt profile with tasty grapefruit citrus and floral hop flavors. Well made, if standard now a days, IPA.

Dark beer with almost no head even with a pretty aggressive pour. What head there was was only a thin slate colored slick. Nose of green coffee beans. Obvious iced coffee flavors with some chocolate, vanilla, and an ashy finish. The lactose sweetness comes out as it warms. Okay coffee stout.

Deep brown/amber color with a thin beige head. Sweet nose with some dark fruit and bananas. Honey sweetness in the flavor with some cereal wheat, dark ripe fruit, some banana and spice. The alcohol gets a bit intrusive as it warms. Nice alternative to the spiced holiday ales.

Dark beer with a thin, lasting, foamy brown head. Rich molasses, chocolate and dark fruit in the nose. This does have a great smooth oily mouth feel. Sweet melted chocolate, molasses, dark overripe fruits, some sweetened coffee, roasted grains and a nice hop presence dancing on top of all of it. This is really easy to drink and the ABV sneaks up on you. Very nice big imperial stout.

Dark beer with some mahogany hues when held to the light. Sticky khaki colored head. Sweet smoky nose. Malt syrup and burnt caramel sweetness with some molasses. Smoked bacon and ash with a long gray hop bitterness in the finish. Pretty nice smoked porter.

Amber color out of the can with a short lived off white head. Malt syrup nose with orange notes. Full flavored beer with fruit, grapefruit rind, caramel, marmalade, malt syrup, and crusty bread. Big alcohol finish. Definitely a warming winter beer.
Deep golden color out of the bottle with a short off white head. Bitter grassy nose. Caramel sweetness with some bread crust, bitter orange, sine fruit and that grassy finish. Solid pale ale

Orange beer with a lasting fluffy off white head. Fresh orange peel nose. Strong hop flavors of candied orange peel, red grapefruit, pineapple and stone fruit, with a bitter piney finish. Thick mouth feel and lots of malty sweetness to balance it out. It drinks very easy for a 8.4% ABV. Very nice beer.
beer_name: Uiltje Met Je Cascade Groene Trui

review_blob: Amber color out of the bottle with a large, foamy beige head. Fresh hop cone nose. Caramel sweetness with some citrus, stone fruit and pine hop notes. Some tart fruit and a dry bitter finish. Okay IPA.
beer_name: Raven Bone Hill Maassluis Stadsbier Hop Explosion

review_blob: Murky brown orange color out of the bottle with a huge, unmanageable foamy head. Nose of puffed wheat with some tart fruit and yeast notes. Flavors of banana, wheat, tart fruit, and some bubblegum in the finish. Interesting beer.

Dark beer with a big aroma of dried fruit and chocolate covered cherries. This is a big, complex beer with lots of chocolate, dried cherries, bourbon, wood, vanilla, molasses, and a warming cherry cordial finish. The ABV sneaks up on you. Very nice, full flavored dessert beer.

Dark beer out of the howler with a short lived and disappearing beige head. Nose of tart fruit, wet wood and some bourbon. Not a lot of carbonation. I get a lot of the tart cherry, a bit of brett funk, wet wood and an alcoholic bourbon in the finish. Hints of milk chocolate. Surprisingly thin body. The brett comes out in the finish. The Arcadia website says this was a late summer/early fall release so Im curious how a grocery store in Avon, OH ended up with a keg in February.
Golden beer with a fizzy white head. Honey sweet nose. Brown sugar sweetness with some lightly toasted grains. A bit cloying but otherwise an unremarkable lager.

Golden color out of the tap with a disappearing white head. Spicy nose with a hint of coriander and bubblegum. Some puffed wheat taste with some coriander, bitter orange, bubblegum, and dusty grains. Dry finish. Tasty beer.
